W3C standards and drafts

W3C publishes a range of technical reports (Standards and supporting Notes) which help move the web forward.

Search for terms such as API, Internationalization, or WAI-ARIA

Not sure where to start? Search for Standards only, any reports in progress, everything tagged with Accessibility, or all reports.

Advanced filter options

Filter by status

Standards
W3C publishes Recommendations which are considered Web Standards. Standards are normative. They are endorsed by W3C and its Members. Learn about our Standards process.
Supporting Notes
Notes are informative. They give you use cases, practices, and code examples.
Supporting Registries
Registries are informative. They document collections of values or other data.
